div.p: ANTONIO: So, as you can see, most of the advice we hear about drinking doesn't tell us how to prevent problems.
ANTONIO: What if the American Heart Association had said, "exercise moderately," rather than giving us specific guidelines?
ANTONIO: Remember the health nut? He thinks two hours a day on his bike is moderate.
ANTONIO: But our friend over on the couch thinks she is exercising moderately, every time she reaches for the remote.
ANTONIO: Or, if the guidelines said, "eat moderately," people might just assume what they normally eat is "moderate." Even if it looked like that...
ANTONIO: Just like in these scenarios, when it comes to alcohol, we've been left to define terms like "moderate" for ourselves.
ANTONIO: So, if most of my friends put away ten drinks in an evening; I might believe drinking six or seven beers is "moderate."
ANTONIO: We really haven't been given specific guidelines that can help us prevent problems with alcohol and drugs. This program will provide clear quantity and frequency guidelines you can use.
